THIS IS AN EXAMPLE CONTRACT THAT USES THE CCIP SENDER IN AN UNSAFE WAY. DO NOT USE THIS IN PRODUCTION. It is unsafe because it does not have any access control modifiers on the `s_lastMessageId` state variable. This means that anyone can call the `getLastMessageId` function to view the latest sent message id, which may not be desirable for all use cases. It is also unsafe because it does not have a whitelist of allowed receivers. Any address can be passed to the `sendMessage` function, which could lead to messages being sent to unintended recipients.","kind":"dev","methods":{"constructor":{"details":"Constructor initializes the contract with the router address.","params":{"_router":"The address of the router contract."}},"sendMessage(uint64,address,string,address)":{"details":"Sends a message to a receiver contract on a destination chain.","params":{"_destinationChainSelector":"The chain selector of the destination chain.","_feeToken":"The address of the token to pay for fees. Set to address(0) for native gas.","_message":"The message to send.","_receiver":"The address of the receiver contract on the destination constructor.details: Constructor initializes the contract with the router address.

params._router: The address of the router contract.

sendMessage(uint64,address,string,addres.details: Sends a message to a receiver contract on a destination chain.

params._destinationChainSelector: The chain selector of the destination chain.
params._feeToken: The address of the token to pay for fees. Set to address(0) for native gas.
params._receiver: The address of the receiver contract on the destination chain.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address.
